result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Amadeo Absalom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Amadeo Absalom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Amadeo Absalom was found guilty of Burglary-Armed w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(a).
  • Daniel Amadeo Absalom was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Electronic Filing Notice-RETURN TO SENDER, NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD (Defendant Daniel A. Absalom)

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date. IT IS FUTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the defendant is assigned shall effect the defendant's  release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Daniel Amadeo Absalom in court in custody with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Perry L Folts appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Count 1 court orders 3 years prison and 5 years extended supervision. Eligable for bootcamp and earned release program Cost due within first 12 months after release. Sentence credit 214 days. Count 2 court orders sentence withheld 3 years probation consecutive to count 1. Costs due within first 12 months after release. Defendant not to be housed in same facility as Samuel Jones

Defendant Daniel Amadeo Absalom in court in custody with attorney Lane Fitzgerald.  Scott Henry Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 3. Court dismisses count 2.  Defendant waives PSI. Bond revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
